'''Wisdom''' is the ability to think and act utilizing knowledge, experience, understanding, common sense, and insight.<ref>"wisdom." Collins English Dictionary - Complete & Unabridged 10th Edition. HarperCollins Publishers. 28 Feb. 2014. <Dictionary.com http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/wisdom>.</ref>
+
'''Wisdom''' is the ability to think and act utilizing [[knowledge]], [[experience]], [[understanding]], [[common sense]], and [[insight]].<ref>"wisdom." Collins English Dictionary - Complete & Unabridged 10th Edition. HarperCollins Publishers. 28 Feb. 2014. <Dictionary.com http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/wisdom>.</ref>
     
In the Western tradition, wisdom has been listed as one of four [[cardinal virtues]]. As a [[virtue]] it is a habit or disposition to perform the action with the highest degree of adequacy under any given circumstance. This implies a possession of knowledge or the seeking thereof in order to apply it to the given circumstance. This involves an understanding of people, things, events, situations, and the willingness as well as the ability to apply perception, judgement, and action in keeping with the understanding of what is the optimal course of action. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that the universal principle of reason prevails to determine one's action. In short, wisdom is a disposition to find the truth coupled with an optimum judgement as to what actions should be taken in order to deliver the correct outcome.

This involves an understanding of people, things, events, situations, and the willingness as well as the ability to apply perception, judgement, and action in keeping with the understanding of what is the optimal course of action. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that the universal principle of reason prevails to determine one's action. In short, wisdom is a disposition to find the truth coupled with an optimum judgement as to what actions should be taken in order to deliver the correct outcome.
